description: N The CBA contains an air terminal building, airline offices, fuel storage and distribution equipment, aircrafts and one runway. The airport was transferred from Transport Canada to the Government of Northwest Territories in 1995, and from the Government of Northwest Territories to the Government of Nunavut in 1999. Under an airport operation transfer agreement between TC and the Government of Nunavut, the Apron area was identified as an area of environmental concern (AEC). Soil sampling indicated that there were exceedances of regulatory guidelines for petroleum hydrocarbon (PHC) in soil and sump water in the Apron area.

### Competitive Tendering for Land Treatment Unit Decommissioning and Remediation Services

**Title/French Title**

EW699-241903 Request for Decommissioning, Remediation and Land Treatment Unit Services, Cambridge Bay, Nunavut
EW699-241903 Demande de propositions pour le projet de mise hors service, d'assainissement de l'unité de traitement des sols de Cambridge Bay

**Tender Details**

* Reference Number: WS4447206800-Doc4518384648
* Solicitation Number: WS4447206800
* Publication Date: 2024-04-03
* Tender Closing Date: 2024-05-07T14:00:00
* Amendment Date: 2024-04-30

**Procurement Details**

* Procurement Method: Competitive - Selective Tendering
* Procurement Category: CNST
* Notice Type: Request for Proposal
* Trade Agreements: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)

**Contract Details**

* Expected Contract Start Date: 2024-06-28
* Expected Contract End Date: 2025-04-02
* Regions of Delivery: Cambridge Bay, Nunavut Territory

**Background**

Public Works and Government Services Canada has a requirement for construction, decommissioning, and remediation services for the Apron Land Treatment Unit located in the Cambridge Bay Airport in Nunavut. Soil sampling has identified exceedances of regulatory guidelines for petroleum hydrocarbon (PHC) in soil and sump water in the Apron area. This procurement is subject to the Directive on Government Contracts in the Nunavut Settlement Area.

**Eligibility**

This Request for Proposal is limited to Inuit Firms registered on The Inuit Firm Registry (IFR).

**Contact Information**

For more information, please visit the notice URL: <https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/19296514?extsite=MTkyOTY1MTRfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==>

For any questions or clarification, please contact Diop, Nafissa (SPAC/PSPC) at nafissa.diop@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca. [](#footer) <!-- link only to English part of rfx -->
